1.text: If one is found slain, lying in a field in the land that the LORD your God is giving you to possess, and it is not known who killed him,

2.text: your elders and judges must come out and measure the distance from the victim to the neighboring cities.

3.text: Then the elders of the city nearest the victim shall take a heifer that has never been yoked or used for work,

4.text: bring the heifer to a valley with running water that has not been plowed or sown, and break its neck there by the stream.

5.text: And the priests, the sons of Levi, shall come forward, for the LORD your God has chosen them to serve Him and pronounce blessings in His name and to give a ruling in every dispute and case of assault.

6.text: Then all the elders of the city nearest the victim shall wash their hands by the stream over the heifer whose neck has been broken,

7.text: and they shall declare, “Our hands did not shed this blood, nor did our eyes see it.

8.text: Accept this atonement, O LORD, for Your people Israel whom You have redeemed, and do not hold the shedding of innocent blood against them.” And the bloodshed will be atoned for.

9.text: So you shall purge from among you the guilt of shedding innocent blood, since you have done what is right in the eyes of the LORD.

10.text: When you go to war against your enemies and the LORD your God delivers them into your hand and you take them captive,

11.text: if you see a beautiful woman among them, and you desire her and want to take her as your wife,

12.text: then you shall bring her into your house. She must shave her head, trim her nails,

13.text: and put aside the clothing of her captivity. After she has lived in your house a full month and mourned her father and mother, you may have relations with her and be her husband, and she shall be your wife.

14.text: And if you are not pleased with her, you are to let her go wherever she wishes. But you must not sell her for money or treat her as a slave, since you have dishonored her.

15.text: If a man has two wives, one beloved and the other unloved, and both bear him sons, but the unloved wife has the firstborn son,

16.text: when that man assigns his inheritance to his sons he must not appoint the son of the beloved wife as the firstborn over the son of the unloved wife.

17.text: Instead, he must acknowledge the firstborn, the son of his unloved wife, by giving him a double portion of all that he has. For that son is the firstfruits of his father’s strength; the right of the firstborn belongs to him.

18.text: If a man has a stubborn and rebellious son who does not obey his father and mother and does not listen to them when disciplined,

19.text: his father and mother are to lay hold of him and bring him to the elders of his city, to the gate of his hometown,

20.text: and say to the elders, “This son of ours is stubborn and rebellious; he does not obey us. He is a glutton and a drunkard.”

21.text: Then all the men of his city will stone him to death. So you must purge the evil from among you, and all Israel will hear and be afraid.

22.text: If a man has committed a sin worthy of death, and he is executed, and you hang his body on a tree,

23.text: you must not leave the body on the tree overnight, but you must be sure to bury him that day, because anyone who is hung on a tree is under God’s curse. You must not defile the land that the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance.
